summary: Build a lifestyle website for adult plushie enthusiasts named "Plushie Haven."
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Cozy plush-themed logo mark with text “Plushie Haven”, warm neutral palette, clean adult lifestyle aesthetic (plushie-haven-logo.dim_512x512.png)
- Homepage hero banner illustration/photo-collage style featuring plush textures, soft lighting, and cozy interior vibes, no people, no explicit elements (plushie-haven-hero.dim_1600x900.png)
- Seamless subtle background pattern inspired by plush fabric texture, low-contrast, tileable (plushie-haven-pattern.dim_1024x1024.png)

existing_features.title: Create the core frontend app for an adult plushie lover lifestyle website named “Plushie Haven”, including a responsive layout with header navigation, footer, and the following pages/sections with English user-facing text: Home (hero + intro), Articles/Guides (list + detail), Gallery (image grid), Community Board (posts list + create post), Events (upcoming list), About, and Contact (non-email form UI with copy-to-clipboard or mailto link).

Implement a consistent, distinctive visual theme for Plushie Haven (colors, typography, spacing, and UI styling) suitable for an adult lifestyle community; avoid a blue/purple-dominant palette. Apply the theme consistently across all pages and components.
Add an age confirmation gate for adult audiences: on first visit, require the user to confirm they are 18+ to enter Plushie Haven, with a persistent “confirmed” state stored locally in the browser.
Integrate Internet Identity sign-in on the frontend and require authentication for creating Community Board posts; unauthenticated users can browse posts but must sign in to post.

Seed the Articles/Guides and Events sections with curated static content appropriate for adult plushie enthusiasts (e.g., care tips, collecting, display ideas, travel/events etiquette), ensuring content remains safe and non-explicit.

Generate and include required static brand images for Plushie Haven, store them in frontend/public/assets/generated, and use them in the UI (e.g., logo in header, hero image on home, subtle background pattern).

new_feature_requests.summary: Create the "Plushie Haven" lifestyle website for adult plushie lovers, featuring plushie-themed content and community elements.

Implement backend support for the Community Board: authenticated users can create, list, and view posts. Each post stores: id, author principal, author display name (optional), title, body, createdAt timestamp. Provide canister methods for createPost and listPosts (and getPost by id if needed for the UI).
